channel.title: TFS Top Tip #10 - Keep Your Shelves Tidy
channel.description: Team Foundation Server source control has a great feature called Shelving.  Shelving lets you set store a batch of pending changes onto the server and optionally remove them from your local workspace.  It comes in really handy for the times...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Francisco Lomas+00:00
item.description: Hi!! Great tip!! One question, is there a way to perform the delete of the shelve in an automatic way? A politic or something?
item.dc:creator: Francisco Lomas

item.title: Comment by imsuryawan+00:00
item.description: very helpful for me... this post give me a better overview of shelving using TFS. thanks..
item.dc:creator: imsuryawan

item.title: Comment by sangita+00:00
item.description: Hi i need urgent help as i unshelved only 1 file and by mistake unchecked check box -'Preserve shelveset on server' so after uncheck of single file my whole changeset has gone!! is there any way to get it back..i think microsoft's functionality flaw that even not giving message before deleting whole shelveset..please help me . thank you.
item.dc:creator: sangita

item.title: Comment by Martin Woodward+00:00
item.description: I do not know of a way of recovering the contents of a shelveset after deleting it - but I'll ask around and see if anyone else knows.
item.dc:creator: Martin Woodward

item.title: Comment by Manu Sharma+00:00
item.description:
Hi,
I have one question. Is there a way we can unshelve pending changes if we know only shelveset name and don't know owner name. Please help.
item.dc:creator: Manu Sharma

item.title: Comment by Ashish+00:00
item.description:
Today , i stuck at same issue to overwrite old shelving-in changes with new one.. i go through your blog and now i have same shelve name with latest changes.
thanks great tip, it help me lot ..
item.dc:creator: Ashish
